monsters.name: Aboleth
monsters.description: The aboleth is an ancient, otherworldly creature of immense power. A massive aberration from the depths of dungeons, it dwells in dark waters, plotting against the realms of mortals.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.description: The aboleth can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Probing Telepathy
traits.description: If a creature communicates telepathically with the aboleth, the aboleth learns the creature's greatest desires if the aboleth can sense the creature.

traits.name: Mucous Cloud
traits.description: While underwater, the aboleth is surrounded by transformative mucus. A creature that touches the aboleth or that hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature can't breathe anything but water for 1 minute. After that time, it can breathe air and water. When the creature regains the ability to breathe air, it loses the ability to breathe water until after its next short or long rest.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The aboleth makes three tentacle attacks.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 17). Until this grapple ends, the target can't breathe unless it can breathe water. If the aboleth moves more than 10 feet away from the target, the grapple ends.

actions.name: Tail
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (3d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Psychic Drain
actions.description: One creature that the aboleth can sense within 30 feet of it must succeed on a DC 16 Intelligence saving throw or take 22 (4d8 + 4) psychic damage, and the aboleth regains hit points equal to the number of hit points the creature lost.

legendaryActions.name: Detect
legendaryActions.description: The aboleth makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendaryActions.name: Tail
legendaryActions.description: The aboleth makes one tail attack.
